column5: ly-eh}}/) is an annual activity held as the concluding part of [[The Tolkien Society]]'s [[Oxonmoot]] celebration.<ref>{{webcite
column7: articlename='The Lord of the Rings': Elvish Lives!

column1: On the Sunday morning of the [[Oxonmoot]] convention, attendees of the event take a coach trip to [[Wolvercote Cemetery]] where [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and his wife [[Edith Tolkien
column2: Edith]] are buried. Enyalië is a "sombre" wreath-laying ceremony which involves a "short act of remembrance" at Tolkien's graveside.<ref>{{webcite
column6: accessed=11 August 2015}}</ref> The Chairman of the Society reads a passage from Tolkien's works whilst the song [[Namárië]] is sung by one of the Society's long-standing members.<ref name="TS">{{webcite
column9: articlename=10 reasons why you should attend Oxonmoot

column1: Chairman of [[The Tolkien Society]], [[Shaun Gunner]], described the event as "poignant and touching" whilst noting that "many regard it as the single most important activity of Oxonmoot".<ref name="TS"/>

column6: articlename=Celebrate Tolkien at Oxonmoot 2006 at Oxford
